oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An account of the doings of a family of lions (apparently a continuation of one of the Ichneumon s speeches, in the myth of the Mantis) gives a good deal of conversation of such a description as might naturally be ascribed by Bushmen to lions (L II.
1170). Also gives details of their sizes and roles in the pride, the teaching of young lions to hunt and other information about their hunting habits.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The doings of a family of lions
